str2: A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To separate from some one, be bereaved. From apo and a derivative of orphanos; to bereave wholly, i.e. separate.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.
Fitting season, season, opportunity, occasion, time. Of uncertain affinity; an occasion, i.e. Set or proper time.
From pros and ops; the front, i.e. The countenance, aspect, appearance, surface; by implication, presence, person.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
Prolonged from a primary kar; the heart, i.e. the thoughts or feelings; also the middle.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Desire, eagerness for, inordinate desire, lust. From epithumeo; a longing.
Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
From pros and ops; the front, i.e. The countenance, aspect, appearance, surface; by implication, presence, person.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: To hasten, be eager, be zealous. From spoude; to use speed, i.e. To make effort, be prompt or earnest.
